title: Why do game reviewers want easy mode in Sekiro? - Quora

response.answer_text: Simple Answer: They suck at the game and don’t want to spend the time to get better. Complex Answer: Some journalists want to get their reviews out faster so they can earn ad revenue. Others are self-entitled and think that the game should cater to their needs. Sekiro is a Souls title from From Software, the makers of the Dark Souls series and Bloodborne. They’re known to make their games incredibly hard for players and that attracts a specific audience. Some reviewers just aren’t cut out to review the game if they are complaining about how hard the game is.

Because Sekiro is harder than Dark Souls Many DS players had a hard time with Sekiro. Anyway on PC, players can use a save trick to make the game easier, and save at any time.  You can't save during a boss fight of course, but at least you can use that trick to never lose items, experience, or retry a boss endless times, after having already cleaned the place of all other enemies.
